ReLU¶

class layers.activation.ReLU.ReLU[source]¶

Implements the ReLU (Rectified Linear Unit) activation layer.

The Rectified Linear Unit is a non-linear function with the formula f(x) = max(0, x). It is one of the most common activation functions used in neural networks because it is computationally efficient and helps mitigate the vanishing gradient problem.

input¶

Stores the input from the forward pass, which is needed to calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

It computes the derivative of the ReLU function and applies it to the incoming gradient from the next layer (using the chain rule).

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since ReLU has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying ReLU.

Return type:

np.ndarray
